subtitleNullable: Tracking over 320 frames from Kentucky Derby Highlights of 2019 to 2022
descriptionNullable:
**MADE TO DRIVE SUPERVISED MODELS ON PREDICTIONS AND IMPROVE BETTING SYSTEMS**
320 frames taken Kentucky Derby Highlights from 2019 to 2022 with horses being tracked per frame – identifying race succession. The dataset is appropriate for training computer vision- and data science-based predictions in horse races to complement betting systems.

The source data was collected from open media, specifically from Kentucky Derby Highlights hosted on YouTube. We took the highlights from 2019 to 2022 where each year’s race are organised in 80 frames (320 in total).

It is difficult to develop a dataset from 2D imageries in open media, especially that of tracking. Therefore, we adopted the consensus-based quality check model of Acme AI – placing three of our quality checkers to blind test the dataset to ensure quality is not compromised. For extreme opaque cases, we used an Unknown classifier.

Each of the horse is tracked by its program number (the number each horse wears on its saddlecloth) and relative position as attributes. Program numbers are sourced from official records of the Derby races.

We used SuperAnnotate’s vector editor to label and classify the images. Export was made in COCO with fused labels to optimise interoperability and visual understanding.

Dataset is created by Acme AI Ltd. ([www.acmeai.tech](https://acmeai.tech/)) and is #openaccess 😊 😊
title: Kentucky Derby Race Tracking
subtitle: Tracking over 320 frames from Kentucky Derby Highlights of 2019 to 2022
